definition: to give a present
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
shower (for bride, baby etc)

sentences.english: In ancient times it was etiquette to present your full-size visiting card when giving someone a gift.
sentences.chinese: 古时候，送礼物时附上自己的名帖，是一种礼仪。

sentences.english: B. His long service with the company was acknowledged with a present.
sentences.chinese: 向他赠送礼品以感谢他长期来对公司的服务。

sentences.english: See examples of theme gift baskets with expert gift giving advice in this free video clip.
sentences.chinese: 请看专家在此免费送礼视频剪辑咨询主题礼篮的例子。

sentences.english: Prudence is using the presents I have been getting as New Year gifts to tradesmen.
sentences.chinese: 普律当丝用我收到的新年礼物来送礼。

sentences.english: It's our custom to unwrap a present in the donor's presence.
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不在送礼人面前打开或者评论礼物。

sentences.english: Keep individual gift giving outside the office.
sentences.chinese: 不要在办公室里单独送礼物。

sentences.english: But the dog egg tenacity and every time I come persistence give to the elderly gifts.
sentences.chinese: 但是狗蛋百折不挠，每次来坚持给给老人送礼。

sentences.english: He said that people exchange gifts at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 他说人们常在圣诞节互送礼物。

sentences.english: Is this really the example you want to set for us impressionable kids?
sentences.chinese: 难道你真的是想送礼物给容易受感动的孩子吗？

sentences.english: It is the heart of the giver that makes the gift precious.
sentences.chinese: 每个送礼者都希望赠送别人珍贵的礼物。

sentences.english: Therefore, the gifts will become the best expression Dayi a mode of communication.
sentences.chinese: 因此，送礼也就成了最能表情达意的一种沟通方式。

sentences.english: The adjudicating personnel shall not accept a treat or gift from the parties or their agents.
sentences.chinese: 审判人员不得接受当事人及其诉讼代理人请客送礼。

sentences.english: Regarding has gives a present the congratulation, Zhou Yumin replied ambiguously .
sentences.chinese: 对于有没有送礼祝贺，周渝民含糊回答。

sentences.english: I was a decent gift giver when we were dating.
sentences.chinese: 我们约会那会儿我是一个像样的送礼专家。

sentences.english: No time for an engagement party or bridal shower .
sentences.chinese: 都没时间办订婚晚会或者新娘送礼会。

definition: to accept a gift/to receive presents
gift/present
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
gift/present/CL:件[jian4],個|个[ge4],份[fen4]
lit. proper behavior is based on reciprocity (idiom)/fig. to return politeness for politeness
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
at the Chinese New Year or other festivities
monetary gift
congratulatory gift
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
goose feather sent from afar, a trifling present with a weighty thought behind it (idiom); It's not the gift that counts, but the thought behind it.
generous gifts
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
